original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka‘s edged up in mid day trade on Thursday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed. The overall market is moving up on domestic debt optimization assurances, picking up several stock counters in the market.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) edged up 0.33 percent or 34.17 points 10,524.15, the most liquid S&P SL20 was up 0.38 percent or 11.63 points to 3,072.13.

The banking sector and diversified financial sectors are picking up on domestic debt optimization assurances, while investors are seeking alternative investments bringing up the market on green, an analyst said.
The controlling stake in Dankotuwa Porcelain called up for a high stake in the market. The consumer durables and apparel sector drew in 2.3 billion rupees in revenue during mid day trade.
Top gainers during 1130 hours were Hatton National Bank, LIOC, Ceylon Cold Stores. (Colombo/July13/2023)
